meanings.definition: A bird of the nightjar family, typically having long wings and a short bill.
meanings.sent1: The nighthawks soared gracefully through the dark sky.
meanings.sent2: I spotted a nighthawk perched on a tree branch at dusk.
meanings.sent3: The nighthawks seemed to be playing hide-and-seek with the moon.
meanings.sent4: In the quiet of the night, the nighthawks danced with the shadows.
meanings.sent5: The nighthawks' haunting calls echoed through the night, creating an eerie atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A person who is habitually active or moving around late at night.
meanings.sent1: The nighthawks in the city streets never seem to sleep.
meanings.sent2: As a nighthawk, she enjoyed exploring the city when most people were asleep.
meanings.sent3: The group of nighthawks gathered at the 24-hour diner for a late-night snack.
meanings.sent4: He was known as a nighthawk, always out and about while others were in bed.
meanings.sent5: The nighthawks roamed the streets like nocturnal wanderers, seeking adventure under the moonlight.
